measured_by: decrease in sensitivity (d' drop) between confidence and decision criteria
justification: "Metacognitive noise manifests as a decrease in sensitivity (d') when computed based on confidence criteria compared to the decision criterion."

measured_by: Signal Detection Theory decision criterion (c) difference between biased and unbiased cues
justification: "We computed the SDT parameter decision criterion (c) to quantify the bias in reporting one choice alternative over the other."

measured_by: binary confidence rating scale (low 50–75% vs high 75–100%)
justification: "Immediately after, they reported their confidence level on a binary scale: low confidence (i.e., 50-75% probability of being correct) or high confidence (75-100% probability of being correct)."

measured_by: drop in stimulus sensitivity (d') for biased criteria versus unbiased criterion
justification: "Computational noise for the biased criteria can be quantified as the drop in stimulus sensitivity (d') compared to the stimulus sensitivity for the unbiased criterion."
